image.altText: A woman with purple hair pulled into a bun and a pink jumper sits on her couch looking down at framed photo of a young man.

props.synopsis: The ashes of Nicole Harrison's nephew Zane are still on a shelf, eight years on from his death in a Tasmanian hospital. Until there are answers as to the true nature of his death, she says there is "no peace".

title.children: 'I can't scatter his ashes': Aunt says she can't find peace until she gets answers over her nephew's hospital death

image.altText: Emerenna Burgess, Legana Hughes and Carleeta Thomas sit outisde a tent, holding an Aboriginal flag

props.synopsis: Tents have been pitched outside Parliament House in Hobart as Aboriginal people demand treaty — and say they won't move until the government commits to treaty legislation.

title.children: Rival treaty group sets up camp on lawns outside Tasmania's parliament amid calls for legislation

image.altText: A young woman holding a black and white photo of her mother.

props.synopsis: Romany Wake and Shakira Robertson used to be next door neighbours. Now they're trying to support each other after both their mothers were killed tragically in separate incidents.

title.children: 'I've just killed your mum': Romany Wake's father committed murder, then told her to call triple-zero

image.altText: Rachel Wake squatting down and pushing a toddler on a bike

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man jailed for the Christmas Day stabbing murder of his ex-wife in 2021 has appealed against the 26-year sentence, arguing it is manifestly excessive.

title.children: Killer of Rachel Wake argues 26-year prison sentence is 'manifestly excessive'

image.altText: Finances generic

props.synopsis: Australia's annual rate of inflation lifted to 3.8 per cent in the June quarter, up from 3.6 per cent.

title.children: Inflation up but RBA's 'core' target fell, delivering 'good news' on future rate rise

image.altText: A man in red jacket, hi-vis and helmet on horseback, a scenic mountain behind them.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Mounted Search and Rescue team has been operating for 50 years. Its tactics and technology have evolved, but it still relies on maps and compasses when modern methods fail.

title.children: Lost in the bush? These men and women might be the ones coming to find you

image.altText: Ismail Haniyeh sitting on a chair with a curtain behind him.

props.synopsis: The Palestinian militant group released a statement to say its top political leader has been killed in Iran. No one immediately claimed responsibility.

title.children: Hamas' top political leader Ismail Haniyeh killed in Iran

image.altText: Ismail Haniyeh puts his right index finger across his stubbled chin as he tilts his head down slightly and looks forwards.

props.synopsis: With the killing in Iran of Hamas leader Ismael Haniyeh, the possibility that all key players have wanted to avoid — a full-scale war between Israel and Hezbollah — is now closer than ever.

title.children: The assassination that could bring full-scale war — and devastation to three countries

image.altText: An empty check in counter inside an airport terminal with signs displaying "check in" for "Rex".

props.synopsis: Administrators overseeing Rex Airlines have told hundreds of employees they are unlikely to receive their wages or redundancy payouts for "months", and expect the domestic aviation business will cease operating by the end of the day.

title.children: 350 Rex Airlines employees stood down immediately as administrators warn staff are unlikely to be paid for 'months'

image.altText: A young white man with short brown hair and glasses out the front of Parliament House in Canberra. He is a wheelchair user

props.synopsis: The federal government has revealed its response to the landmark disability royal commission, but has not committed to a number of the most contentious recommendations.

title.children: Disability advocates 'devastated, disappointed and caught off guard' by royal commission response

image.altText: Roksana Slupek of Poland warms up swimming in the Seine

props.synopsis: Day five of the Paris Olympics begins with the triathlons, as officials deem the Seine safe to swim. Follow live.

title.children: Women's triathlon begins after officials deem Seine safe to swim in despite quality concerns

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Aussies preparing to compete in shooting
Triathlon: Defending champion produces Seine swim blitz
Medal tally: Here's where Australia sits heading into day five

image.altText: A woman standing near a home, holding a gun.

props.synopsis: Vision released by Queensland police shows dramatic moments during the final shootout after a six-hour siege at Wieambilla in December 2022.

title.children: Footage shows final moments of shootout with police after six-hour Wieambilla siege

image.altText: Fencers compete in Le Grand Palais

props.synopsis: Paris offers a rich vein of jewels to house temporary stadiums during the 2024 Olympic Games — but Le Grand Palais, home of fencing, is something else.

title.children: Of all the grand venues being used for the Paris Olympics, the fencing might be housed in the grandest of them all

image.altText: Donald Trump in front of a purple background with the words "Team Trump".

props.synopsis: The director of the "Project 2025" plan for a Donald Trump presidency steps down after Democrats made attacking it central to their election campaign and Trump repeatedly distanced himself from it.

title.children: Project 2025 director ends work on plan for Trump presidency after continued attack from Democrats

image.altText: A screenshot of a youtube video stating that it is unavailable in the viewer's region

props.synopsis: It's the second time an ABC investigation has been geo-blocked in India for its journalism.

title.children: YouTube blocks ABC Four Corners investigation into India's 'nest of spies' targeting Australian critics after Indian government's demand

image.altText: QH artwork

props.synopsis: An Olympic star makes an incredible pregnancy reveal shortly after competing, a gold medallist's moment ruined by overzealous photographers, and Coco Gauff's Olympic dream ends in tears after an umpire run-in. Here are some moments you may have missed overnight in Paris.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: An incredible pregnancy reveal, a gold medal moment ruined by photographers, and Coco Gauff's tearful exit

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings for day five of the Olympic Games

image.altText: An interpretation of the Greek God Dionysus featuring DJ Barbara Butch in a silver headress.

props.synopsis: French DJ Barbara Butch says she's received death threats over her appearance in the Paris Olympics' opening ceremony.

title.children: Police investigating online abuse targeting French DJ caught in 'Last Supper' controversy

image.altText: The historic Billson's Brewery with two chimneys and a faded antique sign on the side

props.synopsis: The owners of a popular drinks company in North East Victoria have described the "excruciatingly difficult" decision to put their business into voluntary administration.

title.children: Jobs at risk as historic Billson's Brewery announces voluntary administration

image.altText: A close-up shot of a shopping trolley full of groceries in a supermarket with a woman behind bagging apples.

props.synopsis: The ASX closed higher after June-quarter inflation data was in line with most economists' expectations. See how the day's trade unfolded on the blog.

title.children: ASX closes higher after inflation rises 3.8 per cent in year to June — as it happened

image.altText: Jim Chalmers blue room

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers faces a nervous wait over the next six days to the Reserve Bank of Australia rate decision even if today's inflation data look to have handed him a brief political 'get-out-of-jail' card.

title.children: Inflation figures may give the government a rate rise reprieve next week, but the path is not yet certain

image.altText: Sabrina James and Marjorie Johnston share a laugh

props.synopsis: In the midst of a housing crisis, roughly 12 million bedrooms sit empty. But housemates Marjorie Johnston and Sabrina James reckon they have hit on a solution.

title.children: With millions of bedrooms empty, this unusual pair have hit upon a housing solution

image.altText: A composite image of three young girls, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift pays tribute to the children killed and injured in a stabbing attack at a dance class being held to her music on Monday, saying she's "completely in shock", as the death toll from the incident rises.

title.children: Taylor Swift pays tribute to children killed in UK stabbing attack at dance class as death toll rises

image.altText: Simone Biles after finishing her routine

props.synopsis: Three years after she missed the same event with the "twisties", Simone Biles has helped the USA win gold in the artistic gymnastics women's team final in Paris.

title.children: Simone Biles breaks US Olympic record with another gold

image.altText: A person in a hazmat suit stands in the front yard of a burnt out home, with emergency vehicles parked out the front.

props.synopsis: A 5-month-old baby girl, and two boys — aged two and six  — were killed when the fire tore through a home in Sydney's west earlier this month.

title.children: Man accused of killing three children in Sydney fire to have hair tested for drugs and alcohol

image.altText: Bronny James and LeBron James

props.synopsis: Last month, the LA Lakers gave themselves the unique opportunity to create NBA history by drafting Bronny James, the son of LeBron James. The first month of the youngster's career has shown he has a tough road ahead.

title.children: LeBron and his son playing on the same NBA team is historic — why is it making basketball fans uncomfortable?

image.altText: A woman soccer player wearing yellow kicks a ball during a game

props.synopsis: Planning your Olympic viewing for tonight? Here's what's happening on day five of the Games.

title.children: Olympics schedule day five: Swimming, BMX, canoe slalom and a must-win match for the Matildas

image.altText: Sharon Firisua iwinim gold long 10,000 metre long Samoa (Samoa Pac Games)

props.synopsis: One of only two Solomon Islands athletes at the Paris games, marathon runner Sharon Firisua was offered the country's wildcard spot in the flagship 100m heats, which kick off on Friday night.

title.children: Marathon runner picked for Olympic 100m sprints, as administrators question 'unbelievable' decision

image.altText: GettyImages-2163919545

props.synopsis: Jessica Fox is proving as relentless as Paris' burning afternoon sun in her hunt for matching gold medals.

title.children: One gold medal isn't enough for Jessica Fox — that's why she's swapping the kayak for the canoe

image.altText: A concrete building is damaged and crumbling after an apparent air attack

props.synopsis: Israel's air force says its air strike targeted Fuad Shukr who it claims was responsible for ordering an attack on Golan Heights that left 12 people dead at the weekend.

title.children: IDF says it has killed 'Hezbollah's most senior military commander' in air strike on Beirut

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair and a half smile ,wearing an orange top, sits at a table

props.synopsis: While the Miles Franklin judges may not have deemed it shortlist-worthy, Charlotte Wood's Stone Yard Devotional is now up for the Booker Prize.

title.children: Aussie Charlotte Wood longlisted for one of the most prestigious awards in international literature

image.altText: propeller airplane with REX logo sits on tarmac at dusk.

props.synopsis: Rex Airlines has entered voluntary administration after a failed bid to take on major airlines on mainline routes. Multiple flights have been cancelled, creating major anxiety for customers. Affected? Here's what you can do.

title.children: Have a flight booked with Rex airlines? Here's what we know about cancellations and refunds

image.altText: The Milky Way appears in a dark night sky as a band of bright stars and clouds. Several people are on the ground taking photos.

props.synopsis: Most people in the world live under light-polluted skies. Our interactives show you how even simple changes can bring the stars back into view.

title.children: From remote to inner city, watch the Milky Way fade from sight due to light pollution
